drinks.name: Triple Decocted Doppelbock
drinks.description: Doppelbock is a rich and malty, smooth full-bodied amber Doppelbock lage with flavors of caramel, molasses, and toasted bread. Decoction is a way of raising the temperature of the mash through boiling, without adding additional water or applying heat to the mash tun. For this batch of Doppelbock the brewers used under-modified malts, which are better suited for decoction mashing, and require additional brewing time. They used these malts not only to pay tribute to the old-style method of German brewing, but to add a smoother, maltier mouthfeel and depth of flavor.

drinks.name: Dunkel
drinks.description: Dunkel is a full-bodied, brown, Munich-style lager with low bitterness and rich toasted-bread-crust and caramel malt flavors.
